description: Roasting broccoli until it is tender and lightly browned will quickly become your favorite way to enjoy it. Simply toss with a few seasonings and pop into a super-hot oven for great results every time.
recipeIngredient: 1 bunch broccoli (about 1 1/2 pounds), cut into florets, stems peeled and sliced or diced
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Toss the broccoli florets with the olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper on a baking sheet. Spread them out and then roast, without stirring, until the edges are crispy and the stems are crisp tender, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I love this easy and healthy recipe, but I prefer the garlic crushed instead of sliced. I put the broccoli in the oven for a few minutes before seasoning, as it dries it out so the olive oil coats it better.
I love broccoli cooked this way! It gives it a whole other taste. Delicious!!!
My family (including young grandchildren) really like this recipe!
It was easy to make. I just added lemon zest and chili flakes before baking. My husband and I loved it.

Good recipe but please check the brocolli after 10 and 15 minutes as mine became black after 20 in a fan forced oven. Had to do it again. Also if you have fan forced I'd Def recommend reducing the temperature to about 400
The lemon and basil gave this dish a very refreshing taste. Everyone loved it.
